DOC.brief_summary: Low back pain ( LBP ) one prevalent type musculoskeletal pain strongly relate disability . The McKenzie method one popular treatment option LBP . The objective study determine effect hands-on McKenzie program pain , disability , spine mobility , posture deviation subject derangement low back pain .
DOC.brief_title: Effect Hands- McKenzie Program Low Back Pain
DOC.detailed_description: Thirty eight patient sub-acute chronic LBP randomly assign McKenzie group ( MG ) control group ( CG ) . The MG perform exercise hands-on procedure ( three session per week ) two week , CG perform exercise two week . Both group home exercise program . The outcome assessment measure pain Pain Numerical Rating Scale ( NPRS ) , level disability Oswestry Disability Index ( ODI ) , spine mobility range motion ( ROM ) lumbar spine , centralization symptom postural alternation postural analysis grid ( PAG ) . By use SPSS version 20 , pair t-test use study effect McKenzie program treatment . An independent t-test use study significance two group .
DOC.criteria: The patient age 18 60 year old , LBP without leg pain , last seven week 12 week ( Dionne et al. , 2008 ) . Additional criterion include recurrent LBP , demonstrate DP mechanical assessment ( Long et al. , 2004 ) , The subject BMI normal ( 17 23.9 ) overweight ( 24 28.9 ) ( Dario et al. , 2015 ) . Patient Eligible . Participants underweight ( BMI < 18.5 ) obese ( BMI â‰¥ 30 ) exclude ( Eymard et al. , 2015 ) . Those contraindication physical exercise accord guideline American College Sports Medicine ( Medicin , 2014 ) , serious spinal pathology ( fracture , tumour , inflammatory disease , ankylose spondylitis ) , nerve root compromise ( e.g. , cauda equine syndrome ) , severe cardiopulmonary disease , SCD , pregnancy exclude .
